definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: It can be easily used with freshing touch, non greasy, protect the skin with favorable moisturizing effect.
sentences.chinese: 虽为乳霜，却出人意料地易于涂抹，触感清爽不油腻。

sentences.english: And yet, according to the MRI, my libido is surprisingly strong.
sentences.chinese: 然而，根据核磁共振成像，我的性驱力出人意料的强。

sentences.english: Dryden often surpasses expectation, and Pope never falls below it.
sentences.chinese: 德莱顿经常出人意料，而蒲柏从不令人失望。

sentences.english: But the comic surface turned out to mask unexpected depths.
sentences.chinese: 但是外表的喜剧色彩却掩盖了出人意料的内心深度。

sentences.english: Surprisingly, the black hole also catapults stars away.
sentences.chinese: 出人意料的是，黑洞也会弹射恒星。

sentences.english: Life is just a box of chocolates, Forrest. You never know what you are going to get .
sentences.chinese: 人生就像一盒巧克力，个中滋味往往出人意料。

sentences.english: But there were unexpected findings too.
sentences.chinese: 但是，也有出人意料的发现。

sentences.english: The 685-page book has unexpectedly become a bestseller;
sentences.chinese: 这本685页的著作出人意料地成为了畅销书。

sentences.english: The results, said Fuligni, were not a complete surprise.
sentences.chinese: 福利格尼说，结果并不完全出人意料。

sentences.english: His unexpected surprising conceits make people astonished and admired.
sentences.chinese: 他的出人意料的比喻令人吃惊之余深为叹服。

sentences.english: To Kitty, however, it does not seem so wholly unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 不过吉蒂却以为这件事并非完全出人意料。

sentences.english: The Twilight franchise has blown up more than anyone could have ever expected back in 2008.
sentences.chinese: 《暮光之城》系类电影在2008年出人意料的爆红。
此外，还有一些更为概括的数据，或许更出人意料。

sentences.english: It's that moment in which Phoebus Apollo makes a sudden and unexpected appearance.
sentences.chinese: 太阳神阿波罗，突然而又出人意料的出现了。

sentences.english: It absolutely does make searching for something on the Intertubes rather surprising and possibly even fun.
sentences.chinese: 它让网络搜索有时变得出人意料甚至非常有趣。

sentences.english: The writer showed ingenuity in creating a surprising ending.
sentences.chinese: 作者别具匠心地设计了一个出人意料的结尾。

definition: turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
due to/to stem from/to go beyond (also fig. beyond reason, expectations etc)/to go against (expectations)
to come as no surprise/as expected
not expected at the outset (idiom)/unforeseen/to be surprised by the turn of events
complete change from the normal state (idiom); quite uncharacteristic/entirely outside the norm/out of character
